column2: P5JS - Animated Gif Collage - Part 1
What you'll do
Let's load up some cool animated gifs as a start to our animated art piece!

Welcome, {{user_name}}! Today, we'll be learning how to make a collage out of animated gifs.If you've never made a collage, don't worry - it's a type of art made by sticking a big collection of different things together.
p5.js has a live online editor we can use - If it doesn't open automatically, use this link: https://editor.p5js.org/
Every p5.js sketch has two main parts: setup() and draw(). The setup only runs once, while the draw stays running on loop.
You can think of setup as where we prepare our canvas and supplies, and draw as where we make our art.
Right now, in setup, we're creating a canvas which is 400 pixels by 400 pixels.
Why don't we make this a bit bigger to give us more space to work with?
Replace createCanvas(400,400); with createCanvas(600,600);
Next, we need to find a gif to use - I like to use giphy to search for gifs. Let's visit http://giphy.com and search for kitten.
Select a gif you like, find the button that says copy link, and click it.
A box will pop up with 3 links in it - Select the web address in the GIF Link box, and press Ctrl + C to copy it.
Now, let's add this gif to our p5.js sketch!
First, we need to declare a variable to store the gif. At the top of your sketch, before setup(), add the following line: let gif;
Next, we need to load that gif. Since we are linking to an external file, we want to make sure the file is loaded before our sketch begins. We can do this by creating a preload() function.
Before setup(), add the following: function preload() { (Press Enter to get a new line) gif = loadImage('url'); (Press Enter to get a new line) }
Now replace url with the link you copied from Giphy.
Now, let's change the background to white so we can see our image better. Add the following line: background(255);
Add our image below that line with: image(gif, 0, 0);
We now know how to display an animated gif from the internet. Next time, we'll learn how to play and pause it!
